result.execSummary:
The defendant Keshawn E Palmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Should defendant successfully complete all conditions set forth by the Court and the probation department, pay all costs and surcharges; have no new contact with the criminal justice system arising to the level of probable cause, Court would consider petitition for expungement.

miscConds.notes: Must obtain GED.  Seek and maintain employment.  Job and vocational training.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with codefendant Billy Ray Jackson.  No contact with address of the offense at 2923 N. 12 Street, City and County of Milwaukee, WI. No contact with any vacant or foreclosed house.

Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Parenting classes/counseling.
Restitution set at zero.
AODA assessment; treatment if needed.  Urine screens

Pay the DNA surcharge, plus all costs and disbursements by the end of the probationary period. Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant, which is nondischargable in bankruptcy.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keshawn E Palmer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: /from Ms. Schultz of Justice Point dated 4/21/14, filed. rn
Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing.

As to the amended count:  Defendant sworn.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, elements and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court modified bail conditions.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.

Defendant Keshawn E Palmer in court with attorney Ann R Auberry.  James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk   On State's motion court amended Count 2 to Criminal Damage to Property under 943.01(1) a Class A misdemeanor.  The defendant waived reading and pled not guilty.

Defendant Keshawn E Palmer in court with attorney Ann Rene Auberry.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties requested a date for plea and sentencing.  Court ordered all conditions of bail to continue.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Keshawn E Palmer in court with attorney Ann Rene Auberry.  Randy Sitzberger for James W Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Deborah M and property she oversees at 809 N Boradway, 53233

Defendant Keshawn E Palmer in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Keshawn E Palmer in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
